intro: Vernonia frutescens, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features showy, blue to purple flower heads that resemble mist, blooming in late summer and early fall. The plant has hairy, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with silver. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
